alert.note: Alert for La Crosse; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 29 at 9:39AM CDT until October 30 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River Near Galesville affecting La Crosse and Trempealeau Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River near Galesville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding mainly impacts wildlands and agricultural pasture land. However the approach to the south end of the County Road VV Bridge over the Black River may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Sunday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 5.6 feet Sunday, November 05. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 04/01/1976. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM CDT.
